docs.snippet: The United States, offering $750,000 for disaster relief next year, has urged the United Nations to expand its two-year-old program of providing assistance to victims of emergencies....
docs.abstract: US, offering $750,000 for disaster relief next yr, urges UN to expand its 2-yr-old program of providing assistance to victims of emergencies; 430 natural disasters have occurred around world in last 10 yrs, according to US records, resulting in 3.5 million deaths and damage estimated at $11-billion; US officials, stressing need for UN to improve its ability to act as assistance coordinator once disaster strikes, note instances where uncoordinated response to emergencies had resulted in mismanagement or serious omissions of needed help (S)

byline.original: Special to The New York Times

docs.lead_paragraph: The United States, offering $750,000 for disaster relief next year, has urged the United Nations to expand its two-year-old program of providing assistance to victims of emergencies.

headline.main: U.S. Is Urging U.N. to Expand Program of Disaster Assistance

docs.snippet: SBA increases from $1,000 to $2,500 arm of disaster repair loans it will make without requiring borrower to put up collateral...

docs.snippet: WASHINGTON, Jan. 27--A "disaster unit" to speed loans to individuals and businesses hit by floods, hurricanes and other calamities has been set up within the Small Business Administration....
docs.abstract: SBA sets up 'disaster unit' to speed loans to stricken individuals and businesses; Sen passes compromise bill

byline.original: By CHARLES E. EGAN Special to The New York Times

docs.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON, Jan. 27--A "disaster unit" to speed loans to individuals and businesses hit by floods, hurricanes and other calamities has been set up within the Small Business Administration.

headline.main: U.S. Disaster Unit Set Up to Rush Loans to Flood and Storm Areas; Small Business Administration Reveals Action to Cut Red Tape, Speed Relief --Congress Voting More Money

docs.snippet: HARTFORD, Nov. 14--Senator Herbert H. Lehman accused the Eisenhower Administration today of failing to cooperate with the Senate Banking and Currency Committee in its flood insurance inquiry....
docs.abstract: hearing, Hartford; Lehman charges lack of Adm guidance is handicapping hearings; Bush challenges remark; Ribicoff backs natl 'catastrophe' fund as ins against losses; Amer Ins Assn official says ins cos would cooperate in Fed program
docs.lead_paragraph: HARTFORD, Nov. 14--Senator Herbert H. Lehman accused the Eisenhower Administration today of failing to cooperate with the Senate Banking and Currency Committee in its flood insurance inquiry.

headline.main: LEHMAN AND BUSH CLASH AT HEARING; Former Says Flood Insurance Inquiry Is Hurt by Lack of Administration Guidance

docs.snippet: TRENTON, Aug. 24 -- A statewide, peacetime disaster-control system, designed to assure fast, efficient relief in any emergency, from a train wreck to a hydrogen bomb explosion, is expected to be put into operation in New Jersey within the next thr...
docs.abstract: Dreyfuss-Dignan-Sharp plan for state-wide NJ control system drafted; details

byline.original: By GEORGE CABLE WRIGHTSpecial to THE NEW YORK TIMES

docs.lead_paragraph: TRENTON, Aug. 24 -- A statewide, peacetime disaster-control system, designed to assure fast, efficient relief in any emergency, from a train wreck to a hydrogen bomb explosion, is expected to be put into operation in New Jersey within the next three months.

headline.main: DISASTER CONTROL MAPPED IN JERSEY; Plan to Assure Efficient and Fast Relief May Be Put Into Operation Within 3 Months

docs.snippet: WASHINGTON, Jan. 17.--President Roosevelt said today that the dispute between Vermont and the War Department over flood control land was a tempest in a teapot....
docs.abstract: Comment on States' rights controversy over Fed flood projects

byline.original: Special to THE NEW YORK TIMES

docs.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON, Jan. 17.--President Roosevelt said today that the dispute between Vermont and the War Department over flood control land was a tempest in a teapot.

headline.main: PRESIDENT TALKS OF VERMONT ROW; Calls It a Tempest in a Teapot, but Hopes for Settlement of the Dispute QUESTIONS LAND SEIZURE Why Not Investigate and Find the Facts, He Asks the Newspaper Men

docs.snippet: LOSS OF THE BARK MEDINA, OF WATERFORD. QUEBEC, Saturday, May 30. The steamer Saguenay, on her first trip to the River du Loup, ran into the bark Medina, of Waterford, 30 miles below this city, striking her amidships. She sunk in 10 minutes. No liv...
docs.lead_paragraph: LOSS OF THE BARK MEDINA, OF WATERFORD. QUEBEC, Saturday, May 30. The steamer Saguenay, on her first trip to the River du Loup, ran into the bark Medina, of Waterford, 30 miles below this city, striking her amidships. She sunk in 10 minutes. No lives were lost.
